intro: Anneslea spinosa, commonly known as the spiny anneslea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with serrated edges. It produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
